intro: Racosperma filicifolium, commonly known as the fern-leaved acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves that resemble ferns. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are followed by pods containing seeds. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Racosperma filicifolium plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various insects and small animals.
